title: FlexDuo: A Pluggable System for Enabling Full-Duplex Capabilities in Speech Dialogue Systems
author: Borui Liao (Kuaishou Technology), Yulong Xu (Kuaishou Technology), Jiao Ou (Kuaishou Technology), Kaiyuan Yang (Kuaishou Technology), Weihua Jian (Kuaishou Technology), Pengfei Wan (Kuaishou Technology), Di Zhang (Kuaishou Technology)
relevance_why: This research presents innovations relevant to audio processing and dialogue systems, particularly in enhancing speech interaction, which aligns well with Dr. Liu's focus on speech and audio processing.
background: Developing a speech dialogue system that allows real-time bidirectional communication while filtering out background noise for improved conversation quality.
contribution: FlexDuo introduces a modular framework that separates duplex control from speech dialogue systems to enhance interaction and response accuracy while also minimizing noise interference.
technical_comparison: Previous methods typically tightly integrated duplex functionality within the overall system, requiring complex modifications for upgrades. This work improves by allowing the integration of separate modules, making it easier to optimize and modify individual components without extensive retraining.
key_innovation: The introduction of an explicit 'Idle' state that intelligently filters non-essential audio inputs to enhance dialogue context and quality.
real_world_impact: This system significantly enhances natural human-machine dialogue interactions, providing practical applications in customer service, personal assistants, and other conversational AI contexts.
limitations: The half-duplex model used with FlexDuo has not been optimized for full-duplex scenarios, limiting its conversational nuances.

new_terms.full-duplex: **Full-duplex** refers to simultaneous two-way communication, allowing both parties to speak and listen at the same time without interruptions.
new_terms.Idle state: **Idle state** is a proposed state in the dialog system that allows the model to ignore irrelevant audio inputs to maintain conversation clarity.
